idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Chord
playNote([58, 60, 65], beats=4, velocity=60) # play 3 note chord for 4 beats
playNote([55, 58, 62, 65], beats=4, velocity=60) # play 4 note chord for 4 beats  
playNote([55, 58, 63], beats=4, velocity=60) 
playNote([53, 57, 60, 65], beats=4, velocity=60)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Drums
kick = 36
snare = 38
hihat = 42
playNote(kick, beats=1, velocity=90) # play kick for 1 beat
rest(0.5)
playNote(snare, beats=1, velocity=80) # play snare for half a beat
rest(0.5)
for i in range(3):
    playNote(kick, beats=0.5, velocity=90)

rest(0.2)
playNote(snare, beats=0.5, velocity=80)

for bar in range(2):  # repeat for 2 bars
    for beat in range(4): # 4 beats per bar
        playNote(kick, beats=0.5, velocity=90)
        if beat % 2 == 1: # If the beat number is odd
            playNote(snare, beats=0.5, velocity=80) # play the snare drum for half a beat with volume 80
        else: # otherwise
            playNote(hihat, beats=0.25, velocity=70) # play the hihat for a quarter beat with volume 70
        rest(0.25)

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# Bass
def play_bass_line(notes, beat, vel): # Function takes notes, beat and velocity
    for n in notes: #loop go through each note
        playNote(n, beats=beat, velocity=vel) # play the current note by using given beat and volume
        rest(0.1)

bass_notes = [60, 62, 59, 60]
play_bass_line(bass_notes, 1, 80) # play the bass line with 1 beat and volume 80
